In 1949, the New Year's lottery postcard was sold for the first time (the first New Year postcard as a postal card), which attracted public attention and became a huge hit.

In 1949, the Otoshidama-tsuki yubin hagaki (nengajo with lottery numbers) was sold for the first time (the first New Year postcard as the official postal card), which attracted public attention and became a huge hit.
sen.cmt: the New Year's lottery postcard→Otoshidama-tsuki yubin hagaki (nengajo with lottery numbers) と修正しました。官製はがき：official post card として修正しました。

sen.j: そしてこれを機に年賀状の取扱量は大きく伸びていった。
sen.e: Taking this opportunity, the handling amount of nengajo greatly increased.
Taking this opportunity, the amount of nengajo being handled increased dramatically.
Taking this opportunity, the amount of nengajo being handled increased dramatically.

sen.j: なお、1955年にアメリカ軍占領下に置かれた沖縄でも年賀はがきが発行され、1956年には年賀切手も発行されている。
sen.e: In 1955, the New Year postcard was issued in Okinawa under American occupation, and new year's postcard stamp was also issued in 1956.
In 1955, the New Year postcard was issued in Okinawa under the American occupation, and the New Year's postcard stamp was issued in 1956.

sen.j: お年玉付郵便はがきは当初、寄付金付きの葉書にくじが付いていたが1956年に寄付金無しの葉書もくじが付くようになった。
sen.e: In the beginning, the lottery was included in donative postcards, but it was included in non-donative postcards as well in 1956.
Initially, the lottery was included in donative postcards, but in 1956 it was also included in non-donative postcards.
Initially, the lottery was included in the charitable postcards, but in 1956 it was also included in the non-charitable ones.
sen.cmt: 寄付金付きの葉書：charitable postcards として修正しました。

sen.j: 1961年から年賀はがきの消印が省略され額面表示の下に消印に模した丸表示を印刷するようにった。
sen.e: Since 1961, the postmark on the new year's postcards has been omitted, and alternatively a circular mark similar to the postmark has been printed below the price indication.

sen.j: 1968年には郵便番号導入により郵便番号枠が追加された。
sen.e: In 1968, cells for zip code were added due to introduction of zip code.

sen.j: 1970年代になると年賀はがきに絵や文字を印刷する年賀状印刷がさかんになっていき、1982年から寄付金付きの年賀はがきにの裏面に絵や賀詞が印刷されるようになった。
sen.e: In 1970's, it became popular to print drawings and letters on the new year's postcards, and such drawings and words of congratulations have been printed on the donative new year's postcards since 1982.

sen.j: 1989年から年賀切手にも、くじが付くようになった。

Since 1989, the lottery has been part of the New Year's postcard stamp as well.

sen.j: 21世紀になるとデジタルカメラで撮った写真入りの年賀状を家庭のパソコンとプリンターで作成・印刷するスタイルが定着した。
sen.e: In twenty-first century, it has become common to create and print the new year's postcards with pictures taken by a digital camera using a personal computer and a printer at home.

sen.j: 2005年からは光沢感がありインクジェットプリンターの印刷に適したインクジェット写真用年賀はがきが発行されるようになった。
sen.e: Since 2005, glossy new year's postcards suitable for ink-jet printing have been sold.

sen.e: Triggered by the postal privatization, new items such as carbon offset new year's postcards and new year's postcards with cartoon characters were released in 2008.

sen.j: 郵便事業にとっては年賀状の通数が多い事と集中した期間に配達しなければならない（もちろん、一般の郵便物や郵便小包などもある）ので、通常の人員だけでなく学生を中心としたアルバイトなども動員して年末年始の作業をする。
sen.e: Because of the huge amount of the nengajo, and the commitment of delivery within a short period (of course there are also common mails and parcels), not only the regular workers but also temporary workers including students work on the postal service at the end of the year and the beginning of the following year.

Given the huge amount of nengajo and the commitment of delivery within a short period (of course there are also common mail and parcels), not only the regular workers but also temporary workers, including students, work in the postal service at the end of the year and the beginning of the new year.

sen.cmt: ”学生を中心とした”という部分を挿入しました。

sen.j: 通常の時期は1つの配達区を1人の担当者が受け持っているが12月にはこの担当者が通常の郵便物の配達順への整理業務を局内で行い、アルバイトが外勤の配達をこなす体制をとることがある。
sen.e: Although one person takes care of one delivery area in normal seasons, in December, sometimes the person manages delivery routes of normal mails in the post office and part-time workers delivers mails outside the office.

Although one person takes care of one delivery area in normal seasons, in December sometimes the person manages the delivery routes of normal mail in the post office and part-time workers deliver mail outside the office.

sen.j: これは、家族の構成や商売上の屋号を熟知した本務者（正規職員）が配達順の整理をするほうが有利なためである。
sen.e: This is because it is more advantageous that a regular worker familiar with family members and shop names on the route manages the delivery routes.
This is because it's more advantageous for a regular worker familiar with family members and shop names on the route to manage the delivery routes.
This is because it's more advantageous for a regular worker familiar with family members and shop names on the route to manage the delivery routes.

sen.j: また、年賀状の区分整理も家族の名前で来ることや住居表示前の旧住所で届くこと、あるいは転居前の住所で届く年賀状も多い事から本務者が内勤をすることが多いと思われる。
sen.e: It is also assumed that the regular workers commonly work in the office because the nengajo may be addressed to a name of a family member, an address indication in an old system, or a previous address before moving.

It's also assumed that the regular workers commonly work in the office because the nengajo may be addressed to a certain family member, or that it may have an address indication in an old system or the old address of a resident who has recently moved.

sen.j: また、いわゆる「平成の大合併」で市町村名の変更のあった地域も多いことから新旧住所の対応などに追われることも考えられよう。
sen.e: There may be another factor that the regular workers have to match an old address with a new address in many areas where the municipal names changed due to so-called 'the great merger of municipalities in the Heisei era.'

There may be another factor whereby the regular workers have to match old addresses with new ones in many areas where the municipal names have changed due to the so-called 'great merger of municipalities in the Heisei era.'

sen.j: 都市部の局など処理量が多く局舎内で作業が出来ない場合、年賀状の区分専門の仮設プレハブ局舎や会議室などを利用して12月下旬の区分作業だけを行う。
sen.e: If the amount of the mails is too large to handle within the post office such as the case of those in urban areas, a temporary prefabricated office or a meeting room is used only for the division work in late December.

sen.j: 大晦日の昼ごろには元日に配達する年賀状を準備し片づけを行い、年賀状臨時体制は終了し翌日の元日に備える。
sen.e: Around noon of the new year's eve, the nengajo to be delivered on New Year's Day are prepared and the office is cleaned, thus the temporary system for the nengajo comes to an end just to wait for New Year's Day.

Around noon on New Year's Eve, the nengajo to be delivered on New Year's Day are prepared and the office is cleaned; thus the temporary system for the nengajo comes to an end in preparation for New Year's Day.

sen.j: 岡山市の最上稲荷近辺では年明けに参道が参拝客で混雑して配達できないため、1978年より1日繰り上げて大晦日（12月31日）に年賀状を配達する（『NHKニュース』より）。
sen.e: In the vicinity of Saijo Inari Shrine in Okayama City, it is difficult to deliver the new year's postcards on New Year's Day due to too many visitors to the shrine, and therefore the nengajo are delivered on the previous day, the New Year's Eve, since 1978 (from "NHK News").

sen.j: 元日の配達は朝に出発式を行う郵便局も多いが、元日には既に山場は終わっており現実に配る年賀状はすでに郵便局にない。
sen.e: In many post offices, a departure ceremony is held before the delivery on New Year's Day, but the peak of the job is over and the nengajo are not in the post office anymore.

sen.e: The nengajo are 'previously sent to the post office near the delivery area or the house of the related person (part-time worker or regular worker), and they are delivered to each family from there.

sen.e: In view of private information protection (against a risk of the nengajo seen by family members at the previously sent address and the like), there are increasing complaints with the 'previously sending' system.

sen.j: 1973年から2004年までは1月2日は配達は休みであったが、2005年より配達日となった。

sen.e: As indicated by the word "refraining from greetings" due to mourning, the concept of sending the postcard is "we are sorry we cannot send a new year's greeting due to the mourning period" rather than "we do not accept a new year's greeting from you" (some people believe it is rude to send the nengajo to a mourning family. it is common to send a kanchuomimai (winter greeting card)).

sen.j: 宋・周輝の「清波雑誌」に「宋元佑年間、新年賀節、往往使用傭仆持名刺代往」と書いている。
sen.e: There is described "宋元佑年間、新年賀節、往往使用傭仆持名刺代往" in 'Qingpo zazhi ' by Chou Hui in Sung
sen.cmt: 読み、意味ともに確認できません。

sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。

sen.j: 当時、士大夫の交際が広く全部新年の挨拶をするということは不可能だった。
sen.e: In those days, shitaifu had a large circle of acquaintances and it was difficult to greet all of them in the new year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そこで親友以外は「梅花箋」という紙で裁った幅2寸、長さ3寸のカードに相手の名前、住所、めでたい言葉を書いて代わりに召使を新年の挨拶をしに行かせる。
sen.e: Therefore, except for best friends, they wrote the name and the address of the receiver and words of congratulation on a 6.06cm-wide and 9.09cm-long card made of baikasen (literally, ume (plum) blossoms paper) and sent an envoy for the new year's greeting.

sen.cmt: クォーツを挿入しました。カッコ内を修正しました。

sen.j: その名刺は現在の年賀状の起源とされている。
sen.e: The name card is believed to be an origin of nengajo.

sen.j: 現在中国の年賀状は日本の年賀状とそれほど代わりがなく、郵便局でも日本と同じ様なくじ年賀状を販売している。
sen.e: The circumstances of nengajo in China is similar to that in Japan now, and the post offices sell the New Year's lottery postcards as in Japan.

sen.j: 世界的に見て年賀状に類似した役割を果たしているもの

tit.j: クリスマスカード、グリーティングカード

sen.j: - ヨーロッパ、アメリカ合衆国、南アメリカ諸国などでは正月に年賀状を交換するのではなくクリスマス前にクリスマス・カードを交わすことが一般的であり、その中で新年のお祝いも述べておくことが多い。
sen.e: - In Europe, the United States of America, and South American countries, it is common to exchange Christmas cards before Christmas, which includes a greeting for the new year.
- In Europe, the United States and countries of South America, it's common to exchange Christmas cards before Christmas, and they include New Year's greetings.

sen.j: 通常12月25日から年末にかけて1週間ほどのクリスマス休暇（ホリデイ）となり、新年はあくまで元日のみが休日で翌1月2日より通常の経済活動・社会活動が再開されるためでもある。
sen.e: They have a Christmas holiday for about a week from December 25 to the year end, but only the New Year's Day is the holiday in the new year and usual economic/social activities start on January second.

Generally, the Christmas holiday lasts for about a week from December 25 to the end of the year, but New Year's Day is the only official holiday for the New Year period and the usual economic/social activities resume on January 2.
